plugins.name: Code Snippet Editor
plugins.description:
Source code and docs are on GitHub


This plugin allows you to write and generate code snippets for Figma nodes, which are rendered in the Inspect Panel in Dev Mode. You can make these code snippets dynamic, by referring to parameters provided by the plugin. Doing this for your component library will bring accurate code snippets to any project that incorporates your design system.


You can add code snippets using the Snippet Editor, which is accessible from the settings menu of the plugin in Dev Mode's Inspect Panel.


Any snippets added to a Component or Component Set will also be propagated to Instances. Snippets can either be static or utilize the snippet templating language, which is documented on GitHub, along with the code for this plugin.

accepted.description: making stuff

plugins.name: Color Contrast Checker
plugins.description:
About

The Color Contrast Checker Plugin helps designers and developers create accessible and visually appealing content by analyzing color combinations according to WCAG guidelines.


How to use

  1. Select the two objects that you want to compare for color contrast and accessibility. These objects should have a solid fill.
  2. Then click on the "Plugins" menu in the Figma app menu bar. Select "Color Contrast Checker" from the list of installed plugins.
  3. The plugin will open a UI window that displays the color contrast ratio, the accessibility level, and the colors selected for the two objects you selected in step 1.

plugins.name: Easy Watermark
plugins.description:
Easy Watermark

The plugin will help you quickly create a watermark layer. If you needed to cover the entire photo/layer/frame with watermarks, then this plugin will help you with this.


How it works:

  1. Add the plugin to your save.
  2. Go to your project and in the plugins section enter "Easy Watermark"
  3. Open plugin
  4. In the window that appears, you can enter text in "Watermark Text" change the size of the distance between the watermarks using "Move by (x)" "Move by (y)"
  5. Move by X - Changes the distance by which the watermark will move in width.
  6. Move by Y - changes the distance by which the watermark will move in height.
  7. Next, you can choose how rotated your watermarks will be.
  8. You can also change the opacity of the watermarks.
  9. For the plugin to start you need to select a layer* in your project.
  10. You can choose whether the watermarks will go beyond the borders.
  11. Finally press the "Create" button and get a group of watermarks that you can place inside the frame in which you would like to see your watermarks.


NOTE:

*The shape layer like a rectangle or an ellipse you choose, will NOT be used as a mask


LINKS:

Support the plugin developer

Gumroad page

Figma community profile
plugins.tagline: Easily add a watermark to your project with the Easy Watermark plugin

plugins.name: Fit Curve
plugins.description:
The Fit Curve plugin helps to create curves with a smooth curvature in Figma. Featuring an intuitive interface with a series of circular buttons and slider, it allows for precise modification of handle lengths on Bezier curve segments.


Features

------------------------------------------

  1. Adaptive Handle Length Adjustment: The eight circular buttons enable users to modify the selected handle's length. The leftmost button sets the handle to the predetermined length in the left field, while the rightmost button aligns it with the right field's value. The six buttons in between provide incremental lengths, giving designers a range of curvature options.
  2. Uniform Handle Scaling: The plus and minus buttons incrementally increase or decrease the length of handles for selected curve segments, providing exact control over the curve‚Äôs shape and tension. Fit Curve symmetrically adjusts both handles of a segment to ensure balanced curves.
  3. Visual Length Indicator: A dynamic blue slider visually represents the handle's length, allowing quick recognition of the curve's curvature degree. Users can make precise adjustments across a range from 1 to 100 percent for fine-tuned control.
  4. Independent Segment Adjustment: The plugin allows for the precise adjustment of individual segments, affording designers granular control over each part of the curve.
  5. Multiple Segment Synchronization: Designers can select and adjust the handles of multiple curve segments at once, significantly improving workflow efficiency for complex designs and extensive projects.
  6. Optimal Curvature Defaults: A handle length set to 55 percent achieves a curve that emulates an elliptical shape or a circle, providing a uniformly curved segment. This default is especially useful for designers aiming for seamless and natural curve transitions.


Feedback and Support

------------------------------------------

If you encounter any issues or have suggestions while using the plugin, please feel free to contact us at hello@thinkbuff.com .

We are eager to hear your feedback and continuously improve the plugin for a better user experience.

You can also join our Discord server where we'll be happy to help you.


Thank you once again for choosing our plugin! If you have any

further questions, feel free to reach out at any time. Wishing you success in your design work!

accepted.name: Eleven
accepted.description: My code was eaten by a üê±.

plugins.tagline: Fit Curve helps to create curves with a smooth curvature in Figma

plugins.name: Mermaid in Figma
plugins.description:
The plugin can create Mermaid chart images and add it to your Figma files.


How to Use

[ Preparation ]

  1. Write your Mermaid code.
  2. Create a text object with your code.


[Mermaid in Figma]

  1. Run the Plugin
  2. Select the text object and click [ Import text ]
  3. Click [ Preview ]
  4. Click [ Export ]. The plugin will draw the image in your file.


Options

  • Export-Width: set the width. The width is the width of the exported image.
  • Scale: set the export scale. If you got an error "Image is too large", please set the small scale. (Please be careful the image could be blur when the scale is too small).
  • Background: (default: transparent)

You can set the background color.

Default is transparent, which I thought is flexible.

  • "Use HTML tags": enable to use HTML tags in your code.

Some types (ex. flowchart) can use HTML tags like "<span>" and change style.

Please be careful that Markdown can be disabled if this option is set as true.


What the plugin can't do

[ Types of charts ]

  • ZenUML - beta
  • Sankey - beta
  • Font Awesome icons


[ Major error ]

  • "Image is too large"


[ Others ]

  • Using <style>. (Please use styling in Mermaid)
  • Import charts as SVG

plugins.name: Waveform
plugins.description:
Waveform

Waveform is a Figma plugin to generate randomized waveform visualizations.


How to Use

Run the plugin and set the desired parameters. Select one or more frames and click on Create Waveform. Waveforms should populate in the selected frames. Clicking on the button lets you redo the generation.


Interface

Properties

Stroke Size: Changes the size of each individual bar

Gap: Changes the space between each bar


Min Height: The minimum height of a bar. This number should be between 0 and 0.5 (Corresponds to the percentage of Frame Height)

Max Height: The maximum height of a bar. This number should be between 0.5 and 1 (Corresponds to the percentage of Frame Height)


Appearance

Stroke Cap: Sets the stroke cap to Round or Square based on the selection

Alignment: Aligns the waveform on the center or the baseline based on the selection

plugins.name: Tailwind React Code Generator - by Pagesloft
plugins.description:
How to use?


1- Select a Figma element:

Choose the element from your design that you want to convert into code by selecting it.


2- Automatic conversion:

Pagesloft will automatically convert your design into clean Tailwind React code.


3- Copy the code:

Once the conversion is complete, copy the generated code.


4- Use it anywhere:

Paste the code wherever you need it, whether it's in a development project, or any other necessary location.


FAQ's


Is it Free to use?

Yes, Pagesloft is completely free to use. You don't need to create an account or pay for a subscription.


Can I convert to HTML, CSS, or Vue?

No, at the moment, Pagesloft only supports React with Tailwind.


Can I convert to JSX without Tailwind?

No, Pagesloft exclusively works with Tailwind CSS.


Do I need to use Tailwind CSS classes in my design?

No, you are not required to use Tailwind CSS classes in your design. Pagesloft will automatically map your design elements to the corresponding Tailwind classes, and if they don't exist, Pagesloft will create them automatically.


Tips


Use Auto Layout!

For pixel-perfect code, use Figma's Auto Layout feature rather than simply grouping elements or using frames. Auto Layout ensures precise and responsive design elements.

Learn more about Auto Layout


Data privacy


The generated code is retained to improve our algorithm. Do not share sensitive or confidential data.
plugins.tagline: Instantly convert Figma designs into Tailwind React

plugins.name: Print PDF | CMYK, ICC, Bleed, Crop Marks, DPI
plugins.description:
Export Print-Ready PDFs from Figma with CMYK, ICC, Bleed, Crop Marks, 300 DPI, and Color Management.


Documentation


For the documentation, please visit https://docs.cooderspro.com


Questions & Support


Print PDF for Figma is still in its early stages, so if you encounter any bugs or have questions about the plugin, we‚Äôre here to help! You can:

  1. Request a feature or submit a defect on the project's Github Issues page.
  2. Get in touch directly via email zouwenqiang678@gmail.com and we'll help you troubleshoot and resolve them as quickly as possible.


Security


Print PDF for Figma is designed to be privacy and security focused - for details about security and how the plugin works, please visit https://docs.cooderspro.com/security


Pricing


  1. Free Usage: Each user receives 5 free exports per month, refreshed monthly.
  2. Pro Subscription: To export beyond the free limit, a Pro subscription is required at $3.9/month.
  3. Subscription Options: At checkout, users can choose manual renewal or auto-renewal. (1) If you select auto-renewal, your subscription is locked at the price at the time of purchase, even if prices increase later. (2) This means, for example, if you subscribed at $3/month, your rate remains $3/month forever, unless you cancel and resubscribe.


Key Features


üìÑ Generate Print-Ready PDFs

One-Click PDF Creation: Select your dimensions, customize page options (margins, bleed, crop marks), and let PrintX handle the rest. It calculates the frames and guides automatically for you.


üé® CMYK PDF Export(Automatically)

Export your files in CMYK color mode for top-tier print quality.


üß© Bleed and Crop Marks Support

Easily add and configure bleed and crop marks to your documents.


‚ö° Customizable Presets

Multiple Presets: Choose from standard paper sizes or create your own, including: Letter, Legal, Ledger ... A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6 ...


üéó ICC Profile Options

Built-in ICC professional color profiles or upload your own.


üçñ Check DPI

Use the DPI tab to see the effective DPI of your images and ensure sufficient resolution.


How to Use


For more details, please visit the documentation https://docs.cooderspro.com

  1. Select Your Frame: Pick a preset size or enter custom dimensions to start.
  2. Adjust Settings: Configure margins, bleed, and crop marks for precision printing.
  3. Export: Choose your color mode and export a ready-to-print PDF directly from Figma.


Quick Tips:


  1. Enable layout guides (Ctrl/CMD-Shift-4) to view bleed and margin guides clearly.
  2. Save time with customizable export presets tailored to your specific needs.

plugins.name: Tour Guide
plugins.description:
Tour Guide turns any FigJam board or page in a Figma file into a slide show presentation! It‚Äôs simple and easy to use:


1. Select any object(s) and add them to your tour.

2. Tap the arrows to navigate your FigJam board or Figma page.

3. Tap the X button to remove a view, or the trash can to erase the current tour.

4. On desktop, drag a view up or down to reorder


With Tour Guide, you can screen share a FigJam board or Figma page as if it were a slide deck, and quickly navigate to the highlights you‚Äôve selected. No more need to scroll and hunt. 


Tour Guide is built with a little intelligence in the background. If you move objects, Tour Guide will continue to follow them around. If you delete objects, Tour Guide will remove them from the tour automatically.


NEW FEATURE! The latest version of Tour Guide automatically creates a tour from an existing selection when you launch the plugin, if no tour exists for that page. This new feature allows you to quickly cycle through "Select all with the same..." selections to assist with style and/or text changes.


I built this plugin so I could present in FigJam and Figma easily, and welcome your feedback to make it even better for the future.

accepted.name: Nelson Taruc
accepted.description: My design philosophy: Focus. Boost signal, kill noise. Solve the first problem. Embrace uncertainty.

plugins.name: Conversis Translation XML Text Export & Import
plugins.description:
Plugin to Export all text from nodes into a translatable XML or XLIFF format.

Once translated, updated text and formatting positions can be re-imported into the design.

Connectors to online CAT solutions being added. Current connections:

  1. Crowdin
  2. memoQ
  3. translate5 - visual preview with translate5


Short YouTube demonstration

Navigate to the "Help" tab in the plugin for information on the options not in the video above.


Export

Once your source file has been created, make a copy of it. export from this copy by clicking Generate file.


Choose to export all font information if you wish to change the fonts within the XML. Useful when mass font changes are required.


Classic (flat) export - export only contains text nodes without other structural elements.


Test layers in selection only - Only export selected text layers

Export Instances - Export each copy of an instance to allow for customised content after instance has been copied.


Skip hidden - hidden layers are not exported


Format - XML or XLIFF


Translation

Use of a CAT tool such as memoQ is recommended.

With XML format, translate the content of the "String" element. consider all elements within that as "Inline". You may wish to segment on "br" elements.

Ensure whitespace is preserved and not normalised. Especially if you are using multiple spaces for controlling layout of text on screen.


XLIFF should import natively into most translation tools, though you may need to add the source language 2-letter code in the "file" tag.


Import

On the import tab use "Choose file" to selected the translated XMLor XLIFF, then click import translations.


Choose to import regardless of source differences.

useful if you want to reimport a modified XML over the top of a previous import.


Connectors

Choose from the list of connector to send/receive from online translation tools.


WARNINGS

  1. Right-to-Left languages aren't well supported in Figma at present
  2. In order for the import to function fully you must not have any missing font warnings on your design.
  3. Contents of the "base" element should remain untranslated. this element is used to check for consistency between the source of the translation and the current contents of the node.

accepted.name: Ian Barrow
accepted.description: CTO @ Conversis

plugins.tagline: Translation XML file export and import with connectors to Crowdin & memoQ

plugins.name: Figmular: Export Figma to Angular components
plugins.description:
Dramatically simplify and speed up your Angular front-end development by effortlessly converting Figma designs to Angular components with just a few clicks. Save countless hours and eliminate the tedious task of manually coding your UI elements.


Are you developing a new page? Building a design system? Using an existing framework like PrimeNG, Angular Material or NG-Zorro (Ant-Design)? Figmular gets you covered!


Now supports Dev Mode and VS Code!


With Figmular you can:


Generate Angular components with the usage of PrimeNG, Angular Material or NG-Zorro (Ant-Design)

  1. If a project is built using PrimeNG, Material Design or NG-Zorro (Ant-Design), Figma components can be configured as components from those libraries. So instead of generating a new code, they will just reference existing components from PrimeNG, Angular Material or NG-Zorro libraries
  2. Design System components have parameters like color, label, type, or others, so Figmular allows to customize their values by reading attributes from the Figma component using Figmular‚Äôs Figma Fields. For example, the Figma property ‚ÄòDisplay Text‚Äô can be configured to be a button‚Äôs label, or the property ‚ÄòType‚Äô can set one of the button types (mat-button, mat-raised-button, mat-stroked-button, etc.)
  3. ‚Ä¶ and actually, the Figma designs do not really need to visually match PrimeNG, Material Design or NG-Zorro for Figmular to work. Any hand-drawn sketch or a rectangle can be configured as an Angular Material component!


Export with components from any custom design system, including your own

  1. Figma design can represent an existing component from a third-party design system or even an in-house design system. Such components can be configured in a ‚Äòcustom‚Äô way, by providing the template code that represents the component
  2. The custom components can also be customized by using Figma Fields in the template
  3. The configuration is stored in a component itself, so it needs to be configured only once to cover all its instances


Convert components from Figma to Angular

  1. Components from Figma can be exported to Angular components that include HTML, CSS, and TypeScript code
  2. When one Figma component uses instances of other components, those other components will be properly exported and referenced with parameters
  3. Even if a Figma component has multiple variants with different properties, it will be exported as a single Angular component with visibility (*ngIf) and class (ngClass) conditions


And of course, any Figma frame or node can be converted to plain HTML and CSS for Angular.


The resulting Angular code can be simply copy-pasted, downloaded in a zip archive, or uploaded to CodeSandbox.


Have questions? Check out our Docs or contact us support@figmular.com

plugins.name: Auto Layout Bar Charts
plugins.description:
Auto layout Bar Charts allows you to paste TSV data directly out of Google Sheets or Excel and turn it into a fully editable horizontal bar chart, constructed using auto layout rows.


After pasting in your data, you'll see settings to assign columns in your data, set the width of your chart and the left margin (for bar labels), and turn on/off headers, values, and x axis ticks.


After running the plugin, you can move rows around using your arrow keys. You can also adjust colours, fonts, and sizes as you normally would in Figma.

plugins.name: Auto Layout Styles
plugins.description:
The plugin brings an experience of Figma styles to the auto-layout feature. You can make separate configurations of auto-layouts, save and load them, lock or change at any time.


üì∫ Demo Video on YouTube


ü§î When do I need it?

  • If you use the same spacers between certain components or elements.
  • If you have a team and want it to use and apply layouts rules in a comfortable way.
  • If you have multiple projects with different spacer setting and want to keep all in consistency.


üßû‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è How it works

The plugin works in the same way as sharable styles in Figma. But the plugin stores these styles as a JSON file.


You can add so many layouts as you want and save them separately as a layouts configuration.


ü§ñ How to use

Before you will start to apply layouts, you need to select two or more elements. Than click ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button and plugin will automatically apply auto-layout styles from the plugin's layout card.


üíæ  Autosave feature

The plugin uses Figma's plugin storage - so even if you closed the plugin without saving, all your changes will be there the next time you launch the plugin again.


ü™¢ Hook names

Hook names is a string that will be applied as an auto-layout layer name.


This is important to have distinguish and unique names for each layout, because only with this condition the plugin will be able successfully update multiple layouts automatically.


üí£ Update all layouts at once by hook names

If you used the plugin before and adjusted all layouts, each type of layout will have a specific name.


Clicking on the ‚ÄúUpdate all by hooks‚Äù button the plugin will go through all layouts on the page and apply layouts styles from you configuration.


üîí Lock composition

Each layout can be locked if you want to make your work with the plugin more safely.


üîó Links

Figma project

My website

plugins.name: Custom Frame Presets
plugins.description:
Create your own sets of reusable frame presets with custom dimensions & other settings. üòç You no longer need to stick to the default limted set of frame sizes which are predefined in Figma.

How to add custom frame presets in Figma?
Create a new collection of presets by clicking the plus (+) icon at the top (leave key field empty). Then click the pencil (edit) icon on the group to add your own presets or edit the names. When done editing the collection, click the checkmark icon near the group name.

Simply click the desired preset to apply it to all selected frames. If no frames are selected, a new frame will be created.

The plugin doesn‚Äôt only save dimensions, but also other frames properties like color, effects, grids and export settings. You also can share your templates with teammates or, if you fancy it, Figma community. Import a shared template by entering the key and pressing plus icon, try it with key ‚Äúbootstrap‚Äù (without quotes).

Resizing the plugin window:
You can resize the window of the plugin by pressing Cmd/Ctrl + Arrow keys when the plugin window is in focus (click anywhere in the window if resize is not working) ‚Äî similar to how you can resize objects in Figma.

Known issues:
‚Ä¢¬†All templates are currently saved locally to your Figma app or browser. If you clear the browser cache, reinstall the app or log out of Figma, your templates may be lost.
‚Ä¢¬†You cannot reoder groups or templates yet. I may add this functionality in the future if there are enough requests.

plugins.name: Skew It, Let's Do It
plugins.description:
Skew any element, or group of elements, in your Figma file.

 

1) Simply select an element, or group of elements

2) Grab those sliders to skew it to your skewy desires

3) See the skewed result live in your Figma canvas.


That's it!


You can also type in the desired skew angle, and use the arrow keys for more precision.


If you‚Äôre having second thoughts you can always reset the element back to it's original values.


You can use this plugin 1x per month for free. After that, you will either have to wait until next month, or purchase a license in your LemonSqueezy store, so we can buy some pizza's. We hope you understand.


Pricing

Figma doesn't allow paid plugins to go cheaper dan $2 per month. Thats why the yearly plan has a discount of 63%, so that the total price of a license is only $8,88


Cancelation

Subscriptions are handled by Figma. You can cancel the plugin subscription by:

  1. Clicking your profile avatar in the top-left corner of Figma
  2. Click Settings
  3. Click Community and find the section Community purchases.
  4. Click the three dots ... next to Skew It Let's Do It
  5. Click Manage subscription
  6. In the newly opened Stripe portal, select Cancel Plan


Cheers and stay skewed just a little!

accepted.name: lonecaptain
accepted.description: Plugin Powerrrrr

plugins.name: Make Hover State
plugins.description:
Take any component or variant set and quickly scaffold hover states for them with interactive components.


By the mad scientists at Shift Lab. Want to work with us? We're hiring!


Get Started

  1. Select one or more components and/or variant sets
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Style your new hover state variants!


This will generate a clone of the existing component (or each variant in a component set), create a variant property group called Hovered with True and False values, and connect the new variant up to the original with a hover interaction trigger.


Limitations

There is currently a limitation with variant sets, where the plugin doesn't work if there is already a property group with the word "hover" in it. This is built in so that in future the plugin can support intelligently completing half-built variant sets, but it seems like it would be very prone to edge cases so I'm not sure if I'll ever support it. For now, use the plugin on either sole components or variant sets without hover states defined.

accepted.name: Frank Johnson
accepted.description: Product Manager / UX Designer at Shift. Lover of DIY culture, CMS design, and the open web.

26713.release_notes:
Added visual feedback for some error states:
- Empty selection or selection containing some non-component or component set nodes
- Selection of some variants within a component set (see Limitations)
- Selection of a component set that already has a "Hovered" property.
